text: [Music]
everybody Thomas Joseph here and I'm
answering a kitchen conundrum that you
all have asked and that is how to make a
perfect cream puff a lot of you are
having problems like this you have a
sunken or deflated cream puff like this
one here or a lot of people encounter a
cream puff like this guy it's too doughy
and you don't get that pocket inside of
the cream puff for your pastry cream
fillings or your whipped cream what you
really are looking for is something like
this a very light cream puff that has a
wonderful pocket in the interior that's
ready to accept any of those delicious
fillings so today I'm going to show you
how to make a perfect cream puff just
like this one so have a cup of water
here in a medium-sized sauce pot I'm
gonna put that over medium heat and to
that I'm gonna add one stick of butter
you want to melt these ingredients
together this is the traditional method
of making patio shoe which is the paste
or dough for a cream puff I'm going to
add a half a teaspoon of coarse salt and
one teaspoon of granulated sugar so the
water butter mixture is up to a boil now
I'm going to add one cup of all-purpose
flour right into the pot and we're gonna
take your wooden spoon and mix this all
together and this pace you have to cook
for about two to three minutes stirring
constantly until a film forms on the
bottom of the pan which is doing right
now I'm gonna turn off the heat and
transfer this now to a bowl just so it
can cool slightly before we add the eggs
and the eggs are the main leavening
agent here that gives you that nice
pocket in the center and such lift to
the cream puffs so our dough has been
cooling for about three minutes and now
I'm going to add four whole eggs one egg
at a time add it and then stirred now
this separates into pieces and it
doesn't seem as though it's going to
come together but with a little bit of
elbow grease this dough will come back
together and once it does that's when
you add your next egg
and the last egg so the dough should be
sticky not slick and it should be stiff
enough to hold a peak when you remove a
spoon or if you touch it with your
finger so it is holding a stiff peak
here and so now I'm going to transfer
this to a pastry bag fitted with a 5/8
inch tip now paddle choux is such a
great dough in that you can make so many
different things with it not only can
you make cream puffs but you can make
eclairs you can make a croquembouche
with all of your cream puffs that you
create and now for the piping now one
trick and we do this often when we're
making things that are sticky like
meringue or cream puff dough like this
take a little bit of dough and just put
it in the corners of your pan then take
a piece of parchment and just stick it
right to the pan and what this does is
it helps keep the parchment on the
bottom of the pan so when you're piping
the sticky filling out the parchment
paper doesn't lift with you and I'm
going to pipe them out into one and a
half inch circles so press down once you
get to the size you need swirl the tip
this is what you don't want to do you
don't want to pull straight up because
you're gonna end up with a point like
this so pipe and then spin the tip so
that you don't have such a pointed top
I'm gonna separate these by a couple of
inches this recipe makes about 28 cream
puffs what you can do if you get any of
these tips is just wet your fingertip
and gently press down because if you do
not they will end up burning in the oven
and now to give that wonderful golden
crust like we have here you need to
brush the tops with a little bit of egg
wash and that will give you a nice
golden shine make sure your oven is
preheated to 375 degrees and these cream
puffs will bake for about 25 to 30
minutes do not open your oven while
these are baking because that will
encourage them to collapse so our cream
puffs are out of the oven they've cooled
completely to fill the cream puffs flip
them over and I like to use a small
paring knife like this and just make a
little
in the bottom and I have some pastry
cream in this bag here and I'm using a
very small tip this is about the quarter
inch tip whatever the smallest tip you
have take the pastry tip and push it
into the cream puffs and fill it you
should be able to feel the weight of the
pastry cream going into the cream puff
itself and there you have it a perfectly
filled cream puff like this if you
wanted to make these for a party you
could even top these with a little bit
of cheese before you bake them to make
Gujjars which are cheese puffs but you
have to remember those four tips in
making pad a shoe like this and that is
when you're cooking the dough make sure
that you cook it long enough so that a
film forms on the bottom of the pan and
incorporate each egg before adding the
next one bake them at a high temperature
like 375 degrees and of course you have
to bake them long enough so don't pull
them out of the oven too soon so there
you have it cream puff 101 with these
tricks and tips you're sure to have
success in the kitchen and your kitchen
conundrum is now solved enjoy
[Music]
you
